ai.summary: The Marble Hill Walk at Felbrigg is a moderate 13.7 km lakeside hike that blends woodland trails, open parkland, and quiet shores. It's suitable for walkers with a reasonable fitness, offering varied terrain, wildlife viewing, and several water-side viewpoints.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines well-marked surfaced paths, compact earth, and occasional muddy stretches after rain. Expect sections along the lake with short boardwalks, gentle climbs, gates or stiles, and some open grassy or woodland stretches. Sturdy footwear with good grip is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Check local weather before setting out; the UK climate can change quickly. Wear appropriate footwear and dress in layers, carrying waterproofs. Stay on marked paths, watch for uneven ground and muddy sections, and be mindful of lake edges and other walkers. Let someone know your plans and expected return. Carry essentials and know where to seek help if needed.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots or shoes with good grip
Comfortable clothing suitable for the season
Map and compass or a fully charged navigation device
Phone in waterproof case or with offline maps
Sun protection (hat and sunscreen) in sunny weather
Insect repellent and a small first-aid kit
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March-October) are ideal; the route is most enjoyable in mild, dry conditions. It can be hiked in winter with proper footwear and clothing.
